patterns: Can you tell me something about Haldia Institute of Technology
I'd like to know more about HIT Haldia
responses: Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) is an autonomous engineering institute in Haldia, West Bengal, India. It is approved by AICTE and affiliated with MAKAUT.
HIT offers undergraduate (B.Tech) and postgraduate (M.Tech) programs in engineering, along with MCA and MBA courses.
The institute has a well-equipped campus with administrative blocks, academic buildings, hostels, a library, and various other facilities.

patterns: Courses at Haldia Institute of Technology
What undergraduate B.Tech programs does HIT offer?
I'm interested in postgraduate M.Tech programs at HIT
What courses are offered in the upcoming semester at HIT?

Does HIT offer a B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Automobile Engineering, BiotechnologyBTech, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electrical engineering
What are the specializations available in the M.Tech in Computer Science program?
Does the MBA program at HIT have a focus on Entrepreneurship?
responses: HIT offers a wide range of undergraduate (B.Tech) and postgraduate (M.Tech) programs in engineering, along with MCA and MBA courses. You can find the complete list of courses on their Click here.

patterns: What can I find on HIT campus?
What amenities are available at HIT?
What sports facilities does HIT have?
responses: The HIT campus spans approximately 37 acres and includes a variety of facilities. These include administrative and academic blocks, student hostels, a library, departmental store, post office, laundry, medical store, bank, ATM, restaurant, open-air cafeteria, and a recreational building.
HIT provides extensive sports facilities, including a football ground, basketball court, and cricket ground.
Our campus offers comprehensive facilities such as a library, gymnasium, cafeteria, student housing, and various sports amenities.

patterns: Hostel facilities at Haldia Institute of Technology
Housing facilities at Haldia Institute of Technology
Where do students stay at HIT?
responses: HIT provides separate housing facilities for boys and girls. The boys' hostels include Newton Hall of Residence, Galileo Hall of Residence, Ranichak Boys Hostel, and Balaji Boys Hostel. The girls' hostels include Tamalika Ponda Seth Hall of Residence and Matangini Hall of Residence.

At HIT, students have access to well-maintained accommodation. Boys can stay in Newton Hall of Residence, Galileo Hall of Residence, Ranichak Boys Hostel, or Balaji Boys Hostel. Girls can stay in Tamalika Ponda Seth Hall of Residence or Matangini Hall of Residence.

Haldia Institute of Technology offers separate hostels for boys and girls. Boys' hostels are Newton Hall of Residence, Galileo Hall of Residence, Ranichak Boys Hostel, and Balaji Boys Hostel. Girls' hostels are Tamalika Ponda Seth Hall of Residence and Matangini Hall of Residence.

The hostel fee is around 12,000 rupees per semester, which is around 2000 rupees per month. This is for lodging only. There is also a 5,000 rupee kasul fee that is returned after completing the degree . The mess at Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) offers a variety of food at different prices. Students pay for what they eat at the end of the month.

patterns: Academic departments at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: Haldia of Technology offers many branches which includs Chemical Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering, Applied Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering.
HIT has schools and departments including School of Engineering, School of Applied Sciences & Humanities, School of Chemical, Food & BioTechnology, and School of Electronics, Computer & Informatics.

Undergraduate departments include Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Applied Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering, Civil Engineering, Applied Sciences, Chemical Engineering, Biotechnology, Food Technology, Computer Science and Engineering, Information Technology, and Electronic and Communications Engineering.

patterns: Cultural and non-academic activities at Haldia Institute of Technology
responses: HIT hosts the annual Science & Technology festival 'PRAYUKTI' and the yearly cultural festival 'RIVIERA' held in May-June.
Student life involves various cultural and non-academic activities, and students participate in clubs and festivals.

patterns: NIRF ranking of Haldia Institute of Technology in 2022
responses: HIT is ranked in the #251 - 300 band among engineering colleges in India by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in 2022 and 109th out of 170 among the engineering colleges by Indian Institutional Ranking Framework (IIRF)

patterns: How to get into Haldia Institute of Technology for B.Tech?
WBJEE and JEE(main) for HIT admission
responses: For B.Tech course, one has to clear the state-level entrance exam WBJEE or JEE(main) and JELET is the exam for 2nd-year lateral entry B.Tech course.

patterns: Average package in Chemical Engineering at HIT
responses: Haldia Institute of Technology (HIT) provides the best placement in the Chemical Engineering Department, with an average package of 8 - 9 LPA.
Our commitment to academic excellence and industry relevance ensures that our students secure rewarding opportunities in the field of Chemical Engineering.

In the academic year 2023-2024, prominent companies that visited Haldia Institute of Technology include Cognizant, Infosys, Wisdom LAB, IBM, Tech Mahindra, CS Automation, Jubilant Foodworks, Axis bank, Accenture, Just Dial, Berger Paints, and Huawei. You can check the complete list here.

patterns: Tell me about the companies in 2023
responses: In the academic year 2022-2023, companies that visited HIT for placements include CTS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Hitech, Ultratech Cement, Berger Paints, Karvy, HSBC, Adani Wilmar, AIS, Kreeti Technologies, XEBIA, Huwaei, and Learning Mate. You can check the complete list here.

Student loans with favorable terms are available to help cover tuition and other expenses. Contact our financial aid department for guidance.

Joining a society is a great way to enhance your college experience. We have numerous clubs focusing on arts, technology, sports, and more.

responses: Our campus offers a variety of dining options, including cafeterias, food courts, and snack bars. For more information on food and dining facilities, please visit the campus life section on our website.
You can enjoy a wide range of cuisines at our on-campus dining facilities, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences.
The dining halls provide healthy and delicious meal options throughout the day, ensuring you have the energy to excel in your studies.

patterns: What is the average package of the college?
Tell me about the placement packages.
What are the average placements like?
How much do students earn on average?
What is the salary range for graduates?
responses: The overall average package for our college is between 4-6 LPA. The CSE department has an average package of 4-5 LPA, with the highest package being 23 LPA. The Chemical Engineering department boasts an average package of 5.5 LPA, with the highest package reaching 22 LPA. The Civil Engineering department has an average package of 5.75 LPA, with the highest package being 27 LPA. Finally, the ECE department has an average package of 5.5 LPA, with the highest package reaching 27 LPA.

On average, students from our college receive packages ranging from 4-6 LPA. Specifically, the CSE department averages 4-5 LPA, with top offers of 23 LPA. Chemical Engineering graduates see an average of 5.5 LPA, with top packages of 22 LPA. Civil Engineering averages 5.75 LPA, with a high of 27 LPA, and ECE department has an average package of 5.5 LPA, with the highest package of 27 LPA.

The average package for graduates across the college is 4-6 LPA. CSE graduates have an average of 4-5 LPA and a highest offer of 23 LPA. Chemical Engineering has an average of 5.5 LPA and a high of 22 LPA. Civil Engineering graduates average 5.75 LPA with top offers of 27 LPA, while ECE graduates also average of 5.5 LPA, with the highest offers reaching 27 LPA.

Graduates typically receive an average package between 4-6 LPA. The CSE department sees averages of 4-5 LPA, with the highest at 23 LPA. Chemical Engineering averages 5.5 LPA with top packages of 22 LPA. Civil Engineering averages 5.75 LPA with the highest at 27 LPA, and ECE averages 5.5 LPA with top offers reaching 27 LPA.

patterns: Who is the principal of HIT?
Tell me about the principal of Haldia Institute of Technology
Principal of Haldia Institute of Technology
Details about the principal of HIT
Who heads Haldia Institute of Technology?
responses: The principal of Haldia Institute of Technology is Dr. Subrata Mondal. He is an esteemed academician and administrator with a significant contribution to the field of education and engineering. Under his leadership, HIT continues to strive for excellence in technical education and research.

patterns: Who is the chairman of HIT?
Tell me about the chairman of Haldia Institute of Technology
Chairman of Haldia Institute of Technology

Who heads Haldia Institute of Technology?
responses: The chairman of Haldia Institute of Technology is Lakshman Chandra Seth. He is a prominent figure known for his contributions to the educational and social sectors. Under his guidance, HIT has seen significant growth and development, maintaining its commitment to providing quality education.
